title: Is there such thing as 'insanity'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Insanity is a terrible and crippling state of mind... I mean you can't describe it beyond saying an uncontrollable inability to perceive life as it is. And it often causes people to behave in ways that are very awful and sad... in ways that otherwise they never would. Spend some time with a manic depressive if you really want to know. It's not like taking a hallucinogen. It's like never being at peace. Words are ever-evolving. I wouldn't worry about people adopting a slang definition for "insane." If you want the definition for insanity then look it up in a dictionary. If you want to understand how insanity affects someone then go out and find somebody... I trust that it won't be as inviting an atmosphere as "Apple banana Cheesecake, OMG i am like SO crazy! :D" Frankly I'd just stick with those latter folks. And lastly hope to God that you never do know what insanity feels like. Insanity Workout Really Does Work but like any workout program, you have to put in the work. It's designed to give you results in less time. The Insanity workouts are pretty intense but the instructor is great at pushing you and keeping the workouts fun. Is there such thing as "insanity"? For me “crazy” and “insane” are just insults that some Einstein in Britain, Denmark, Spain and multiple other countries came up towards the end of the Middle Ages/Enlightenment era, fearful of those who think differently. I swear I’m really gonna insult the next one who calls me it. Yes, there is. Insanity is sometimes missused, but it’s a real thing. Insanity (like other mental states) aren’t just thinking differently. They are very specific mindsets that have certain characteristcs. Depression, for example, can be considerd a different tway of thinking (or at least causes it). That doesn’t mean it doesn’t exist.
